Test.Name: Correct response
Test.Description: Check BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY test when DUT return Correct response.

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
EVENT-2-1-17 BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY
STEP 1 - Get Event service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
Timeout of 60 seconds will be used
STEP 3 - Subscribe Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Check that the DUT returned Subscribe response STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that CurrentTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Check that TerminationTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Validate CurrentTime and TerminationTime STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Check if the DUT returned SubscriptionReference STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Check if SubscriptionReference contains address STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Check that URL specified is valid STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Start listening STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Set Synchronization Point Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Wait for notification Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Validate notifications SOAP packet STEP PASSED
STEP 15 - Check that DUT sent notification messages STEP PASSED
STEP 16 - Validate messages STEP PASSED
STEP 17 - Delete Subscription Manager Send unsubscribe request Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
TEST PASSED

Test.Name: Wrong response: TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time for Subscribe
Test.Description: Check BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY test when DUT return Wrong response: TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time for Subscribe. Set Subscrition timeout to 60s

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
EVENT-2-1-17 BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY
STEP 1 - Get Event service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
Timeout of 60 seconds will be used
STEP 3 - Subscribe Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Check that the DUT returned Subscribe response STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that CurrentTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Check that TerminationTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Validate CurrentTime and TerminationTime TerminationTime < CurrentTime + InitialTerminationTime STEP FAILED
STEP 8 - Delete Subscription Manager Reference to Subscription Manager has not been obtained Wait until Subscription Manager is deleted by timeout STEP PASSED
TEST FAILED

STEP 2 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED

STEP 8 - Check if the DUT returned SubscriptionReference STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Check if SubscriptionReference contains address STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Check that URL specified is valid STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Start listening STEP PASSED

Test.Name: Wrong response: wrong format of UTC in Notification
Test.Description: Check BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY test when DUT return Wrong response: wrong format of UTC in Notification.

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
EVENT-2-1-17 BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE - NOTIFY
STEP 1 - Get Event service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
Timeout of 60 seconds will be used
STEP 3 - Subscribe Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Check that the DUT returned Subscribe response STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that CurrentTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Check that TerminationTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Validate CurrentTime and TerminationTime STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Check if the DUT returned SubscriptionReference STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Check if SubscriptionReference contains address STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Check that URL specified is valid STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Start listening STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Set Synchronization Point Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Wait for notification Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Validate notifications SOAP packet The 'UtcTime' attribute is invalid - The value '2001-10-10T66:24:57.321' is invalid according to its datatype 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema:dateTime' - The string '2001-10-10T66:24:57.321' is not a valid XsdDateTime value. STEP FAILED
STEP 15 - Delete Subscription Manager Send unsubscribe request Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
TEST FAILED

STEP 1 - Get Event service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
Timeout of 60 seconds will be used
STEP 3 - Send Subscribe request Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Check that TerminationTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Validate times STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Check if the DUT returned SubscriptionReference STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Check if SubscriptionReference contains address STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Check that URL specified is valid STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Set Synchronization Point Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Wait for notification Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Check that DUT sent notification messages STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Validate CurrentTime and TerminationTime STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Check that a maximum number of 2 Notification Messages is included in PullMessagesResponse STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Response is not empty STEP PASSED
STEP 15 - Validate messages Topic Device is incorrect: root topic must have namespace defined STEP FAILED
STEP 16 - Send Unsubscribe request Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
TEST FAILED

Test.Name: Checking of listener for NOTIFY messages is created
Test.Description: Script was added to check #211 ticket (Kingfisher projeckt): "After a Subscribe message the device starts sending Notify messages. It often takes some tries until a connection to the endpoint in the test tool is possible (should work immediatly after the Subscription is started)"

ExpectedResult.TestSummary: Run test with Wiresharck log Make sure that Notify message will be received by TT

Test.Name: Correct response: fault to Subscribe
Test.Description:
Check all BASIC NOTIFICATION INTERFACE tests when DUT sends fault to Subscribe requies. Tests shall be passed:
9.2.1 - 9.2.6 Tests should be treated as Passed in case when device sends any SOAP fault in response to Subscribe (except FaultException)
